title: DOSbox for Quake?
content:
I just downloaded the Quake 1 demo, and it won't run in DOSbox. Is there a fix/patch for that like there is for BM (Which I finished today for the first time)?


If there is anyway to get it to work, I'd love to know.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: DOSbox for Quake?
content:
DOSBox's site says it should run and be playable... what's your problem exactly?
Actually I know very little about Quake, so I don't think I'd be able to help anyway.
Perhaps it's better, or at least easier, to use a source port?Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: DOSbox for Quake?
content:
It's doing the same thing that Biomenace would do. It'll move, but it's so slow that a slug could out pace it.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: DOSbox for Quake?
content: It works well enough for me, but still suffers from a little slowdown. It might just be your computer. Unless you specifically want the retro look, I suggest looking up glQuake, which looks better and can run under Windows at high resolutions. Even better is Qrack, which is also a nifty texture and lighting update.
